title: Blended Microlearning Course for Interdisciplinary Social Welfare Education

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of foundational social welfare terminology and interest in interdisciplinary collaboration
context.additional_context: Delivering 5–10-minute microlearning modules in mobile environments with digital devices, supplemented by extracurricular activities via real-time collaboration tools.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze interdisciplinary problems occurring in social welfare settings from at least three perspectives
Learners complete simulation activities collaborating with experts from other fields via mobile learning modules at ≥80%
Learners achieve ≥3 points on a 4-point scale evaluating interdisciplinary communication strategy application in formative assessments
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
